pageContext.claim: “And, you know, a number that, let's say a year ago, wouldn't have sounded great but now sounds incredible: 7.8 percent unemployment. Think of it. People were talking about 42 percent.”
pageContext.analysis: The U.S. was never facing 42 percent unemployment — economists predicted 20 percent unemployment. Oddly, this isn't the first time Trump mentioned a fake 42 percent unemployment while campaigning. In 2016, he regularly claimed the "real" unemployment rate was 42 percent, earning him Four Pinocchios.
